title: Album Page, "Sketches of Campanile of San Zeno, Verona, Italy", late 19th century
medium: Graphite on very smooth, off-white wove paper, folded and tipped into binding with fabric
inscribed: Recto, in graphite, left side of sheet: various inscriptions with measurements and calculations; upper right side of sheet: 1st Logia [sic]; San Zeno / Verona. Verso, in graphite, left sheet at upper right corner: 125; bottom right corner: 118; verso of right sheet: inscriptions with calculations.
dimensions: Sheet: 30.8 x 41.8 cm (12 1/8 x 16 7/16 in.), irregular
description: Horizontal sheet folded and tipped into binding creating two drawing surfaces.  At left is an elevation of a Romanesque style campanile, while to the right is a section through of the same structure showing its stories and also a round arched interior structure on the first and fourth stories.  This sketch also indicates the wall thickness with dimensions taken at various heights.  The right side of the sheet is a view in plan and section of the first loggia of the campanile, consisting of four sides each with a triple arcade supported by two slender columns.  There are further inscriptions about the dimensions of the architectural elements throughout.

tombstone.epitaph: Album Page, "Sketches of Campanile of San Zeno, Verona, Italy", late 19th century.Graphite on very smooth, off-white wove paper, folded and tipped into binding with fabric. Gift of Mrs. William Greenough. 1943-51-294.
